title: Kimberly Kolb’s Novel, ‘Lindsey’, Receives Praise From ‘Presumed Innocent’ Writer Scott Turow
text:
A teenage girl learns important lessons about the value of friendship while navigating the daily challenges of high school life in “Lindsey: Love and Intrigue” (published by iUniverse). The young adult novel by Kimberly Kolb recently received praise from celebrated best-selling author Scott Turow. Lindsey Morgan Brooks, a hard-working high school junior from Emit, Mich., still sees herself as the new kid in school. Even though Lindsey considers a few of her classmates as friends, she lacks self-confidence. To complicate matters, her crush on fellow junior Chris Buckley seems to be unrequited.
Lindsey battles her insecurities while building friendships and steering clear of the many landmines encountered in high school, like the “Neanderthal” jocks, or a group of popular girls she has dubbed the “Fab Five.” Between homework and gymnastics, Lindsey is so consumed with thoughts of Chris, she is unaware that she is the target of prying eyes.
Turow is the author of ten works of fiction, two works of nonfiction and numerous book reviews for the New York Times. In 2010, he was elected president of the Authors Guild.
In a personal email to Kolb, Turow writes:
"‘Lindsey’ is a lovely (young adult) tale of young love and deep intrigue. Lindsey Brooks faces a peril all the more invisible because of the seemingly normal veneer of popular girls and teen crushes she deals with at high school every day."
“Lindsey”
By Kimberly Kolb

About the Author
Kimberly Kolb was born in Brooklyn, N.Y., and has a bachelor’s degree in industrial organizational psychology from the University of Illinois. She resides with her husband and three children north of Chicago and finds writing to be both relaxing and compelling. This is her first published book.
